# Introduction

During the COVID-19 pandemic I created some worksheets based on A Level Maths and Further Maths. I've decided to upload these to my blog in case they can be of use.

# Determinants and Transformations

1.  For each of the following matrices, find their determinant and state if an inverse matrix will exist.

<!-- -->

(a) $$
        \begin{pmatrix}
        1 & 2 \\
        3 & 4 \\
        \end{pmatrix}
        $$

(b) $$
        \begin{pmatrix}
        3 & -1 \\
        0 & 1
        \end{pmatrix}
        $$

(c) $$
        \begin{pmatrix}
        2 & -2 \\
        2 & -2
        \end{pmatrix}
        $$

(d) $$
        \begin{pmatrix}
        6 & -4 \\
        9 & \frac{1}{2}
        \end{pmatrix}
        $$

(e) $$
        \begin{pmatrix}
        0 & 0 \\
        1 & 1
        \end{pmatrix}
        $$

(f) $$
        \begin{pmatrix}
        2 & -1 \\
        -8 & 4
        \end{pmatrix}
        $$

    ------------------------------------------------------------------------

<!-- -->

2.  Given the matrices $$ \text{A} = \begin{pmatrix}
         3 & -2 \\
         0 & 8
         \end{pmatrix} $$ and

$$ \text{B} = \begin{pmatrix}
        -4 & 7 \\
        1 & 2
        \end{pmatrix}. $$

(a) Calculate $\text{det(A)}$ and $\text{det(B)}$

(b) Without calculating the product $\text{AB}$, find $\text{det(AB)}$ <!-- -->

    ------------------------------------------------------------------------

<!-- -->

3.  A triangle T with points A(0,0), B(2,2) and C(2,0) is acted on by a transformation matrix $$ \text{R} = \begin{pmatrix}
         2 & 0 \\
         0 & 2
         \end{pmatrix}$$

<!-- -->

(a) Find T', the image of the triangle T under the matrix R.

(b) Describe the transformation given by the matrix T.

(c) Calculate the determinant of the matrix R. How does this value relate to the transformation.

    ------------------------------------------------------------------------

<!-- -->

4.  By considering the image of the unit square under the following matrices, describe the transformation they represent.

<!-- -->

(a) $$\begin{pmatrix}
        \frac{1}{2} & 0 \\
        0 & 2
        \end{pmatrix}$$

(b) $$\begin{pmatrix}
        -1 & 0 \\
        0 & 1
        \end{pmatrix}$$

(c) $$\begin{pmatrix}
        0 & -2 \\
        1 & 0
        \end{pmatrix}$$

    ------------------------------------------------------------------------

<!-- -->

5.  By considering the effect on the unit vectors $$\begin{pmatrix}
         1 \\
         0
         \end{pmatrix}$$ and $$\begin{pmatrix}
         0 \\
         1
         \end{pmatrix},$$ find the 2 x 2 matrix which represents a reflection in the line $y = -x$.

    ------------------------------------------------------------------------

6.  Find the 2 x 2 matrix which represents a rotation of 120° anticlockwise about the origin.

    ------------------------------------------------------------------------

7.  An irregular pentagon has coordinate matrix $$P = \begin{pmatrix}
         0 & 0 & 1 & 1 & 2 \\
         0 & 1 & -1 & \frac{3}{2} & 0
         \end{pmatrix}.$$

<!-- -->

(a) 

    i.  Find the matrix Q which represents a stretch, scale factor 2, in the y-direction.

<!-- -->

ii. Apply this matrix to P.

<!-- -->

(b) 

    i.  Find the matrix R which represents a rotation of 30° clockwise about the origin.

<!-- -->

ii. Apply this matrix to the results of (a) ii. .

<!-- -->

(c) 

    i.  Find the matrix S which represents the effect of matrix Q followed by R.

<!-- -->

ii. Apply this to P and confirm the resulting matrix is identical to the result in (b) ii. .
